article_content:
## HR.1

The One Big Beautiful Bill Act (H.R. 1) became Public Law No. 119-21 on July 4, 2025. The bill reduces taxes, modifies spending for various federal programs, increases the statutory debt limit, and addresses agencies and programs across the government. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-bill/1](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-bill/1)


**Committees**

This bill is in the House Budget Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00)


**Sponsor**

Rep. Arrington, Jodey C. is the sponsor of the bill.  [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-arrington-jodey-c/A000375](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-arrington-jodey-c/A000375)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

This bill has no cosponsors.  The top 5 cosponsors are not listed on the House Budget Committee's website [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00).


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill as of yet.  [Congress.gov](https://www.congress.gov/) does not provide data on hearings for bills.


**Amendments**

There have been 20 amendments proposed to the bill.  [Please note that the specific content of these amendments is not provided.]


**Votes**

The bill was passed by the House with a vote of 218 to 214.  [Roll no. 190](https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-bill/3059/votes) The Senate also voted on the bill, and it passed by a party-line vote of 51 to 50. [Record Vote Number: 372](https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-bill/3059/votes)

## HR.5371

The Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act, 2026 provides continuing FY2026 appropriations for federal agencies [link: https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-bill/5371]. It also extends various extensions and provides additional funding for security for federal officials. The bill is currently in the process of being considered by the Senate.


**Committees**

This bill is in the House Appropriations Committee and the House Budget Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00)  [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00)


**Sponsor**

Rep. Cole, Tom is the sponsor of the bill. [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-cole-tom/C001053](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-cole-tom/C001053)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

This bill has no cosponsors.  The top 5 cosponsors are listed as the Appropriations Committee and Budget Committee [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00) and [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00).


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill based on information available through Congress.gov.


**Amendments**

No amendments have been proposed to the bill.  There are no related links.


**Votes**

The Senate voted on the motion to proceed to consideration of the motion to reconsider the vote by which the fourth cloture on the motion to proceed to H.R. 5371 was not invoked. The vote was a party-line vote with 54 senators voting in favor and 45 voting against. [Record Vote Number: 590](https://www.congress.gov/vote/?id=590)

## HR.5401

The Pay Our Troops Act of 2026 provides continuing appropriations for military pay during periods when interim or full-year appropriations are not in effect, such as during a government shutdown.  The bill is currently referred to the House Committee on Appropriations. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-bill/5401](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-bill/5401)


**Committees**

This bill is in the House Appropriations Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00)


**Sponsor**

Rep. Kiggans, Jennifer A. is the sponsor of the bill. [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-kiggans-jennifer-a/K000399](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-kiggans-jennifer-a/K000399)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

The bill was cosponsored by 20 members of Congress.  Rep. Fitzpatrick, Rep. Mace, and Rep. Kean are among the top 5 cosponsors. [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-fitzpatrick-brian-k/F000466](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-fitzpatrick-brian-k/F000466)  [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-mace-nancy/M000194](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-mace-nancy/M000194) [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-kean-thomas-h/K000398](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-kean-thomas-h/K000398)  [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-crenshaw-dan/C001120](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-crenshaw-dan/C001120) 
The bill is in the House Appropriations Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00)


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill according to congressional records. [https://www.congress.gov/](https://www.congress.gov/)


**Amendments**

No amendments have been proposed to the bill.  There are no related links.


**Votes**

No votes have been taken on the bill yet.  [Link to search results]

bill_title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2026
article_content:
## S.2296

The National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2026 sets forth policies and authorities for the Department of Defense (DOD) programs and activities, military construction, and national defense. The bill was passed by the Senate on October 9, 2025, with a vote of 77-20. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/2296](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/2296)


**Committees**

This bill is in the House Armed Services Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-armed-services-committee/ssas00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-armed-services-committee/ssas00)


**Sponsor**

The sponsor of the provided text is Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS].  You can view his profile here: [https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-wicker-roger-f/W000437](https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-wicker-roger-f/W000437)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

The bill has no cosponsors.  [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-armed-services-committee/ssas00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-armed-services-committee/ssas00)


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill as of yet.  [Find more information about the bill](https://www.congress.gov/).


**Amendments**

The bill has 20 proposed amendments.  [Link to the bill]


**Votes**

The bill was passed by the Senate on October 9, 2025 with a vote of 77 to 20. [Record Vote Number: 570](https://www.congress.gov/vote/?id=570) This vote was bipartisan.

bill_title: A bill to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 154 First Avenue East in Jerome, Idaho, as the "Representative Maxine Bell Post Office".
article_content:
## S.24

This bill, titled "A bill to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 154 First Avenue East in Jerome, Idaho, as the 'Representative Maxine Bell Post Office'", seeks to rename the U.S. Postal Service facility at 154 First Avenue East in Jerome, Idaho as the "Representative Maxine Bell Post Office".  The bill is currently in the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs stage of its legislative process. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/24](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/24)


**Committees**

This bill is in the House Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-homeland-security-and-governmental-affairs-committee/ssga00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-homeland-security-and-governmental-affairs-committee/ssga00)


**Sponsor**

Sen. Crapo, Mike is the sponsor of the provided information.  You can view his profile here: [https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-crapo-mike/C000880](https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-crapo-mike/C000880)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

Sen. Risch, James E. is the sole cosponsor of this bill.  He is also a member of the Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-risch-james-e/R000584](https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-risch-james-e/R000584)  [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-homeland-security-and-governmental-affairs-committee/ssga00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-homeland-security-and-governmental-affairs-committee/ssga00)


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill as of yet.  [Find more information about congressional hearings](https://www.congress.gov/about).


**Amendments**

No amendments have been proposed to the bill.  There are currently no related congressional documents available on congress.gov.


**Votes**

No votes have been held on the bill.  [Link to search results]

bill_title: Continuing Appropriations and Extensions and Other Matters Act, 2026
article_content:
## S.2882

The Continuing Appropriations and Extensions and Other Matters Act, 2026 provides continuing FY2026 appropriations for federal agencies.  It also permanently extends the expanded premium tax credit for purchasing health insurance. The bill is currently in the process of being debated and voted on. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/2882](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/2882)


**Committees**

Please provide the bill text or information about the bill so I can determine which committees it is assigned to.


**Sponsor**

The sponsor of the provided text is Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA].  You can view her profile here: [https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-murray-patty/M001111](https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-murray-patty/M001111)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

This bill has no cosponsors.  [https://www.congress.gov/bill/118th-congress/house-bill/275](https://www.congress.gov/bill/118th-congress/house-bill/275)


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill according to congressional records. [Find more information about the bill](https://www.congress.gov/).


**Amendments**

No amendments have been proposed to the bill.  There are no links available.


**Votes**

There have been three vote-related actions on the bill, S. 2882. The first two votes were cloture motions to proceed with the measure.  The final vote was a record vote where the Senate voted 47-50 against invoking the third cloture motion and 47-52 against the second cloture motion. [Link to Record Vote Number: 557](https://www.congress.gov/vote/557)  [Link to Record Vote Number: 550](https://www.congress.gov/vote/550)

## S.499

The Government Shutdown Prevention Act of 2025 provides continuing appropriations to prevent a government shutdown if an appropriations bill for a fiscal year has not been enacted before the fiscal year begins.  The bill is currently in the Senate and has been read twice and referred to the Committee on Appropriations [link: https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/499].


**Committees**

This bill is in the House Appropriations Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/ssap00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/ssap00)


**Sponsor**

Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY] is the sponsor of the provided information.  You can view their profile here: [https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-paul-rand/P000603](https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-paul-rand/P000603)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

This bill has no cosponsors.  The top 5 cosponsors are not listed on the House Appropriations Committee website: [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/ssap00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/ssap00).


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill.  [Find more information about the bill](https://www.congress.gov/).


**Amendments**

No amendments have been proposed to the bill.  There are no related links.


**Votes**

No votes have been taken on the bill.  [link to search results]

bill_title: An executive resolution authorizing the en bloc consideration in Executive Session of certain nominations on the Executive Calendar.
article_content:
## SRES.412

This bill, titled "An executive resolution authorizing the en bloc consideration in Executive Session of certain nominations on the Executive Calendar," was agreed to by the Senate without amendment on October 3, 2025 (Record Vote Number: 541).  The resolution passed with a vote of 51-46. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-resolution/412](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-resolution/412)


**Committees**

Please provide the bill text or information about the bill so I can determine which committees it is assigned to.


**Sponsor**

Sen. Thune, John is the sponsor of the provided information.  [https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-thune-john/T000250](https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-thune-john/T000250)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

The bill has no cosponsors.  [https://www.congress.gov/bill/118th-congress/house-bill/1743](https://www.congress.gov/bill/118th-congress/house-bill/1743)


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill as of yet.  [Find more information about congressional hearing procedures](https://www.congress.gov/about/hearings).


**Amendments**

Two amendments have been proposed on the bill. The specific content of these amendments is unknown.  [Link to source]


**Votes**

The bill was passed by the Senate with a vote of 51-46 on October 3, 2025 [link to resolution]. This vote was not bipartisan as it was a party-line vote. The cloture vote on the measure also resulted in a party-line vote with a result of 53-46 on October 1, 2025 [link to cloture vote].

bill_title: Impeaching Donald John Trump, President of the United States, for high crimes and misdemeanors.
article_content:
## HRES.353

This resolution, H.R. 353, is an impeachment resolution against former President Donald Trump for high crimes and misdemeanors. It sets forth seven articles of impeachment. The bill has been notified to the House that it will be offered as a privileged resolution. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-resolution/353](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-resolution/353)


**Committees**

This bill is in the House Judiciary Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-judiciary-committee/hsju00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-judiciary-committee/hsju00)


**Sponsor**

Rep. Thanedar, Shri is the sponsor of the bill.  [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-thanedar-shri/T000488](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-thanedar-shri/T000488)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

Rep. Mfume, Kweisi [D-MD-7], Rep. Nadler, Jerrold [D-NY-12], and Rep. Kelly, Robin L. [D-IL-2] are cosponsors of the bill.  Rep. Schakowsky, Janice D. [D-IL-9] is also a cosponsor. [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-mfume-kweisi/M000687](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-mfume-kweisi/M000687)  [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-nadler-jerrold/N000002](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-nadler-jerrold/N000002) [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-kelly-robin-l/K000385](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-kelly-robin-l/K000385)  [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-schakowsky-janice-d/S001145](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-schakowsky-janice-d/S001145)


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill according to Congress.gov. [https://www.congress.gov/](https://www.congress.gov/)


**Amendments**

No amendments have been proposed to the bill.  There are no related links available.


**Votes**

No votes have been recorded for this bill.  [link]

bill_title: Full-Year Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act, 2025
article_content:
## HR.1968

The Full-Year Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act, 2025 provides continuing FY2025 appropriations for federal agencies and extends various expiring programs and authorities. The bill became public law on March 15, 2025 (link: [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-bill/1968](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-bill/1968)).


**Committees**

This bill is in the House Appropriations Committee and the House Budget Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00)  [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00)


**Sponsor**

Rep. Cole, Tom is the sponsor of the bill. [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-cole-tom/C001053](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-cole-tom/C001053)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

This bill has no cosponsors.  The top 5 cosponsors are on the Appropriations Committee and Budget Committee [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00) and [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00).


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill as of yet.  [Find more information about congressional hearings](https://www.congress.gov/hearings).


**Amendments**

The bill has 20 total amendments.  [Please note that the specific content of each amendment is not provided.]


**Votes**

The bill passed the Senate on March 14, 2025 with a vote of 54 to 46. [Record Vote Number: 133](https://www.congress.gov/vote/133) This was a party-line vote.  A cloture motion was also invoked on the measure. [Cloture Motion](https://www.congress.gov/vote/128)
